when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used as a general greeting during the day.
example: こんにちは、お元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, ogenki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used when parting ways, especially for a long time.
example: 友達にさようならを言いました。 (tomodachi ni sayounara wo iimashita.) - I said goodbye to my friend.

when_to_say: Used to refer to water, usually when requesting or discussing it.
example: 水をください。 (mizu wo kudasai.) - Please give me water.

when_to_say: Used when talking about eating food.
example: 私はリンゴを食べます。 (watashi wa ringo wo tabemasu.) - I eat an apple.

when_to_say: Used to describe moving from one place to another.
example: 学校に行きます。 (gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used to describe something large in size.
example: 大きい家があります。 (ookii ie ga arimasu.) - There is a big house.

when_to_say: Used to describe something small in size.
example: 小さい犬がいます。 (chiisai inu ga imasu.) - There is a small dog.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or quickness.
example: 彼は走るのが早いです。 (kare wa hashiru no ga hayai desu.) - He is fast at running.

when_to_say: Used to express liking or fondness.
example: 私は猫が好きです。 (watashi wa neko ga suki desu.) - I like cats.

when_to_say: Used to address or refer to a teacher.
example: 先生に質問しました。 (sensei ni shitsumon shimashita.) - I asked the teacher a question.

when_to_say: Used when referring to books.
example: 私は本を読みます。 (watashi wa hon wo yomimasu.) - I read a book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a car.
example: 私の車は赤いです。 (watashi no kuruma wa akai desu.) - My car is red.

when_to_say: Used when talking about food.
example: 食べ物が好きです。 (tabemono ga suki desu.) - I like food.

when_to_say: Used to express the action of going.
example: 学校に行きます。 (gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used to express the action of seeing.
example: 映画を見るのが好きです。 (eiga wo miru no ga suki desu.) - I like watching movies.

when_to_say: Used to ask a question or listen.
example: 先生に質問を聞きました。 (sensei ni shitsumon wo kikimashita.) - I asked the teacher a question.

when_to_say: Used when talking about Japan.
example: 日本に行きたいです。 (nihon ni ikitai desu.) - I want to go to Japan.

when_to_say: Used when referring to study or learning.
example: 私は毎日勉強します。 (watashi wa mainichi benkyou shimasu.) - I study every day.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a friend.
example: 彼は私の友達です。 (kare wa watashi no tomodachi desu.) - He is my friend.

when_to_say: Used when talking about a house or home.
example: 私は家にいます。 (watashi wa ie ni imasu.) - I am at home.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a dog.
example: 犬が好きです。 (inu ga suki desu.) - I like dogs.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a cat.
example: 猫がいます。 (neko ga imasu.) - There is a cat.

when_to_say: Used to express liking.
example: 私は日本語が好きです。 (watashi wa nihongo ga suki desu.) - I like Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the speed of an action.
example: 早く走ってください。 (hayaku hashitte kudasai.) - Please run quickly.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is slow.
example: 彼は遅いです。 (kare wa osoi desu.) - He is slow.

when_to_say: Used when referring to something new.
example: 新しい車を買いました。 (atarashii kuruma wo kaimashita.) - I bought a new car.

when_to_say: Used when referring to something old.
example: この本は古いです。 (kono hon wa furui desu.) - This book is old.

when_to_say: Used when referring to price or height.
example: この店は高いです。 (kono mise wa takai desu.) - This store is expensive.

when_to_say: Used when referring to cheap or low price.
example: この店は安いです。 (kono mise wa yasui desu.) - This store is cheap.

when_to_say: Used when referring to cheap or low price.
example: この店は安いです。 (kono mise wa yasui desu.) - This store is cheap.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the sky.
example: 空が青いです。 (sora ga aoi desu.) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: Used to describe hot weather or objects.
example: 今日は暑いです。 (kyou wa atsui desu.) - It's hot today.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather.
example: 冬は寒いです。 (fuyu wa samui desu.) - Winter is cold.

when_to_say: Used when referring to rain.
example: 雨が降っています。 (ame ga futteimasu.) - It's raining.

when_to_say: Used when referring to snow.
example: 雪が積もっています。 (yuki ga tsumotteimasu.) - The snow is piling up.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the wind.
example: 今日は風が強いです。 (kyou wa kaze ga tsuyoi desu.) - The wind is strong today.

when_to_say: Used to describe an enjoyable experience.
example: 旅行は楽しいです。 (ryokou wa tanoshii desu.) - Traveling is fun.

when_to_say: Used to describe something frightening.
example: ホラー映画は怖いです。 (horaa eiga wa kowai desu.) - Horror movies are scary.

when_to_say: Used to describe a kind person.
example: 彼女は優しいです。 (kanojo wa yasashii desu.) - She is kind.

when_to_say: Used to describe strength.
example: 彼はとても強いです。 (kare wa totemo tsuyoi desu.) - He is very strong.

when_to_say: Used to describe weakness.
example: その家は弱い構造です。 (sono ie wa yowai kouzou desu.) - That house has a weak structure.

when_to_say: Used when referring to school.
example: 私は学校に通っています。 (watashi wa gakkou ni kayotteimasu.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used when referring to time.
example: 時間がありません。 (jikan ga arimasen.) - I have no time.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a train station.
example: 駅まで歩きます。 (eki made arukimasu.) - I walk to the station.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a hospital.
example: 病院に行きます。 (byouin ni ikimasu.) - I am going to the hospital.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a park.
example: 公園で遊びます。 (kouen de asobimasu.) - I play in the park.

when_to_say: Used when referring to running.
example: 彼は速く走ります。 (kare wa hayaku hashirimasu.) - He runs fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe the action of flying.
example: 鳥が空を飛びます。 (tori ga sora wo tobimasu.) - Birds fly in the sky.

when_to_say: Used to describe the action of eating.
example: 私はご飯を食べます。 (watashi wa gohan wo tabemasu.) - I eat rice.
